tasks.title: Token Usage Tracking & Cost Visualization
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Build a LIVE token usage tracking system with cost visualization for GitHub Copilot billing

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Track total token usage over time with visual chart - LIVE updates (within 30 seconds)
- Break down token usage PER TASK in Mission Control (beginning to completion)
- Show live token count for each running agent in Agent Activity Monitor
- Convert tokens to estimated dollar cost using known model rates
- Show BOTH literal token amounts AND estimated cost everywhere
- Track which agent uses which model, and apply correct rate per model
- Accurate cost prediction that matches GitHub billing (~$40 this period)
- Track efficiency over time
- ALL THREE visualization types required (line chart, bar chart, treemap)

INTEGRATION REQUIREMENTS:
- NEW PAGE in Agent Activity Monitor: "Token Tracking" tab
  * All 3 visualizations live here (line chart, bar chart, treemap)
  * Dedicated page for token/cost analysis
- ACTIVE AGENTS page: Show per-agent token count + estimated cost (based on model rate)
- AGENT HISTORY page: Show total tokens used + cost for each historical agent
  * Future agents will have this data
  * Past agents before implementation won't have data (acceptable)

MODEL RATE TRACKING (CRITICAL):
- Must track: model name + input tokens + output tokens per request
- Apply correct rates per model:
  * Claude Opus 4.5: $15/1M input, $75/1M output
  * Claude Sonnet 4.5: $3/1M input, $15/1M output  
  * GPT-4o: $2.50/1M input, $10/1M output
  * GPT-4o-mini: $0.15/1M input, $0.60/1M output
  * Gemini Pro: ~$1.25/1M input, $5/1M output
- Never mix up which tokens came from which model
- Per-agent model tracking (each agent may use different model)

CONSTRAINTS:
- GitHub Copilot subscription only (no direct billing API)
- Must be LIVE - auto-refresh within 30 seconds
- Must integrate with existing Agent Activity Monitor (monitor_server.py)

DELIVERABLES:
1. Token tracking system that logs: task_id, agent_id, model, input_tokens, output_tokens, timestamp
2. NEW "Token Tracking" page in Agent Activity Monitor with THREE visualizations:
   a) LINE CHART: Total token usage over time (hourly/daily), with cost overlay
   b) STACKED BAR CHART: Per-task breakdown, segments for input/output, shows cost per task
   c) TREEMAP/SUNBURST: Hierarchical view - Total → Categories (Heartbeat/Tasks/Ad-hoc) → Individual items
3. ACTIVE AGENTS page update: Show tokens used + cost per agent card
4. AGENT HISTORY page update: Show total tokens + cost for each historical agent
5. Cost estimation showing tokens + dollars side by side everywhere
6. Model-aware tracking (correct rates per model per agent)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Anthony can see at a glance how much each task costs (tokens + dollars)
- Anthony can predict monthly billing from dashboard
- Clear breakdown of where tokens are going (heartbeat vs tasks vs agents)
- All visualizations update LIVE (within 30 seconds of token usage)
- Cost estimates match actual GitHub billing within reasonable margin
- Token Tracking is a dedicated tab in Agent Activity Monitor

tasks.title: Mission Control: Last Updated Timestamps + Auto-Sort by Recent
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Show last updated time on task cards and sort by most recently updated

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Every task card on dashboard shows "Updated: X time ago" or "Updated: 1:45 PM" BEFORE opening
- When ANY change happens to a task (subtask added/crossed off, comment added, status change), timestamp updates
- Tasks within each column (backlog, in_progress, review) sorted by MOST RECENTLY UPDATED at top
- I can see at a glance which tasks are being actively worked on
- Agent MUST add a comment whenever crossing off subtasks, adding subtasks, or making any change
- This behavior must be HARDCODED into identity files (HEARTBEAT.md, AGENTS.md, SOUL.md)
- Must create a SKILL that enforces this behavior for future reference

CONSTRAINTS:
- Must work with existing Mission Control dashboard
- Must update in real-time with auto-refresh
- Sorting must be per-column (not global)

DELIVERABLES:
1. Dashboard update: Show "Updated: [timestamp]" on each task card (visible without clicking)
2. Dashboard update: Sort tasks within each column by lastUpdated descending (newest first)
3. mc CLI update: Ensure every operation updates the lastUpdated field
4. Identity file updates: HEARTBEAT.md, AGENTS.md, SOUL.md - hardcode the rule to always add comments on changes
5. Create skill or script that documents/enforces this behavior
6. Auto-comment on subtask changes (when crossing off, adding, or modifying subtasks)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Anthony can see which tasks were updated most recently without opening them
- Most recently updated tasks float to top of each column
- Every subtask change triggers a comment explaining what changed
- Agent behavior is hardcoded - never forgets to update timestamps and add comments
